column4: very quick question: how do I find a SMP kernel?? Suddenly my machine is non-SMP
cant find any -smp packages...
the generic kernel is smp, the i386 not, i think
hmm, just installed generic, previous was 386
so, you are OK then?
yes.. =)
now I "just" need to fix my Nvidia driver ;)
what do you mean by that?
well my GLX was not working
generic should recognize the two cores, so there's a problem somewhere. nevertheless, how did you install the nvidia driver?
it was the downloadable shell thing from Nvidia
oh, ok. since it seems you want to use the latest version of the driver (and not the older in the repos) then you it would be better to use Envy.
is that the fancy nvidia installer thing?
yes, it will download the driver from nvidia and install it for you
I will try that
but remember, everytime time there's an kernel update you will lose your desktop
aaah, right

if you want to avoid this you should install the driver from the repos. or before you reboot the pc after the kernel update you have to change the driver in xorg.conf from nvidia to nv or vesa and then put it back
I will try the ubuntu one I think
yes, the driver from the repos is "kernel update safe" :) although, it's an not the latest version
do you know that you have booted with the generic kernel for sure? or i386 is still used. do a "uname -a" to be sure
no, I was still on 386
bah!
